bitfield.description: This register provides the highest priority enabled interrupt index.

bitenum.description: no interrupts pending
This interrupt indicates that either WINHI interrupt or WINLO interrupt has occurred in SDHS.
This interrupt is valid when ASQ is activcve (auto mode). The interrupt indicates that the time counter in ASQ has reached to TIMEMARK_F (timeout).

This interrupt is valid when ASQ is activcve (auto mode). The interrupt occurs when ASQ completes all of the measurements programmed in ASCTL0.PNGCNT. For example, when ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3, total four measurements are performed. The interrupt indicates that all of the four measurements have been completed.

This interrupt is valid when ASQ is active (auto mode). The interrupt occurs when ASQ completes one measurement sequence. For example, when ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3, total four measurements are performed. The interrupt indicates that one measurement has been completed.

bitfield.description: This interrupt indicates that either WINHI interrupt or WINLO interrupt has occurred in SDHS.
This bit indicates a TIMEMARK F (timeout) event has happened.

This interrupt is valid when ASQ is activcve (auto mode). The interrupt occurs when ASQ completes all of the measurements programmed in ASCTL0.PNGCNT. For example, when ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3, total four measurements are performed. The interrupt indicates that all of the four measurements have been completed.

This interrupt is valid when ASQ is active (auto mode). The interrupt occurs when ASQ completes one measurement sequence. For example, when ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3, total four measurements are performed. The interrupt indicates that one measurement has been completed.
This interrupt indicates that either WINHI interrupt or WINLO interrupt has occurred in SDHS.
This bit indicates a TIMEMARK F (timeout) event has happened.

This interrupt is valid when ASQ is activcve (auto mode). The interrupt occurs when ASQ completes all of the measurements programmed in ASCTL0.PNGCNT. For example, when ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3, total four measurements are performed. The interrupt indicates that all of the four measurements have been completed.

This interrupt is valid when ASQ is active (auto mode). The interrupt occurs when ASQ completes one measurement sequence. For example, when ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3, total four measurements are performed. The interrupt indicates that one measurement has been completed.
This bit indicates a DMA access violation
This bit enables the DATAERR interrupt.
This bit enables the TIMEMARK F (timeout) interrupt.
This bit enables the SEQDN interrupt
This bit enables the PNGDN interrupt
This bit indicates a DMA access violation
Writing one this bit to clear the pending DATAERR interrupt.
Writing one this bit to clear the pending TIMEMARK F (timeout) interrupt
Writing one this bit to clear the pending SEQDN interrupt.
Writing one this bit to clear the pending PNGDN interrupt.
Writing one this bit to clear any previous DMA access violations
Writing one this bit generates a DATAERR interrupt by software.
Writing one this bit to generate a TIMEMARK F (timeout) interrupt by software.
Writing one this bit to generate a SEQDN interrupt by software.
Writing one this bit to generate a PNGDN interrupt by software.
Writing one this bit to set RIS.DAV by software.
Minor Revision
Major Revision
Instance Number
Feature Version
CH0_OUT Enable. When OSEL.PCH0SEL =0, this bit enables the output CH0 when set to 1. When OSEL.PCH0SEL != 0, this bit is invalid.

bitenum.description: Ch0 Output is HiZ
CH0 Output is driving

bitfield.description: CH1_OUT Enable. When OSEL.PCH1SEL =0, this bit enables the output CH1 when set to 1. When OSEL.PCH1SEL != 0, this bit is invalid.

bitenum.description: Ch1 Output is HiZ
CH1 Output is driving

bitfield.description: CH0_OUT Value. When OSEL.PCH0SEL =0 and OCTL0.CH0OE=1, this bit represents the logical value on the CH0 terminal. 0 = low 1 = high

bitenum.description: Ch0 is set to low signal
Ch0 is set to high signal

bitfield.description: CH1_OUT Value. When OSEL.PCH1SEL =0 and OCTL0.CH1OE=1, this bit represents the logical value on the CH1 terminal. 0 = low 1 = high

bitenum.description: Ch1 is set to low signal
Ch1 is set to high signal

bitfield.description: CH0 termination switch (SWG0) enable. When OSEL.PCH0SEL =0, this bit controls the SWG0 switch. 0 = SWG0 is off. 1 = SWG0 is on. The CH0_OUT is disabled and connected to PVSS via SWG0 switch. No need to change OCTL0.CH0OE status.

bitenum.description: CH0 Output is defined by CH0OUT and CH0OE
CH0 Output is set low with termination strength

bitfield.description: CH1 termination switch (SWG1) enable. When OSEL.PCH1SEL =0, this bit controls the SWG1 switch. 0 = SWG1 is off. 1 = SWG1 is on. The CH1_OUT is disabled and connected to PVSS via SWG1 switch. No need to change OCTL0.CH1OE status.

bitenum.description: CH1 Output is defined by CH1OUT and CH1OE
CH1 Output is set low with termination strength

bitfield.description: DRV0 (output driver on the CH0_OUT) full strength enable. 0 = The DRV0 output impedance is deterimed by CH0PUT and CH0PDT registers. 1 = The DRV0 has lowest output impedance.

bitenum.description: Ch0 Output is set to normal strength
Ch0 Output is set to maximum strength

bitfield.description: DRV1 (output driver on the CH1_OUT) full strength enable. 0 = The DRV1 output impedance is deterimed by CH1PUT and CH1PDT registers. 1 = The DRV1 has lowest output impedance.

bitenum.description: Ch1 Output is set to normal strength
Ch1 Output is set to maximum strength

bitfield.description: Output functional select for CH0_OUT.

bitenum.description: CH0_OUT is used as a GPO pin. It is controlled by OCTL0.CH0OUT and OCTL0.CH0OE.
CH0_OUT is driven by the PPG.
CH0_OUT is driven by the PPG as differential output along with CH1_OUT. (CH0_OUT and CH1_OUT are alwasy opposite polarity)
CH0_OUT is used as a GPO pin. It is controlled by OCTL0.CH0OUT and OCTL0.CH0OE.

bitfield.description: Output functional select for CH0_OUT.

bitenum.description: CH1_OUT is used as a GPO pin. It is controlled by OCTL0.CH1OUT and OCTL0.CH1OE.
CH1_OUT is driven by the PPG.
CH1_OUT is driven by the PPG as differential output along with CH0_OUT. (CH0_OUT and CH1_OUT are alwasy opposite polarity)
CH1_OUT is used as a GPO pin. It is controlled by OCTL0.CH1OUT and OCTL0.CH1OE.

bitfield.description: DRV0 pull up trim register. Write access is allowed only when TACR.UNLOCK=1. For secure the trim value, it is recommended to keep TACR.UNLOCK=0 during normal operation.
DRV0 pull down trim register. Write access is allowed only when TACR.UNLOCK=1. For secure the trim value, it is recommended to keep TACR.UNLOCK=0 during normal operation.
SWG0 trim register. Write access is allowed only when TACR.UNLOCK=1. For secure the trim value, it is recommended to keep TACR.UNLOCK=0 during normal operation.
DRV1 pull up trim register. Write access is allowed only when TACR.UNLOCK=1. For secure the trim value, it is recommended to keep TACR.UNLOCK=0 during normal operation.
DRV1 pull down trim register. Write access is allowed only when TACR.UNLOCK=1. For secure the trim value, it is recommended to keep TACR.UNLOCK=0 during normal operation.
SWG1 trim register. Write access is allowed only when TACR.UNLOCK=1. For secure the trim value, it is recommended to keep TACR.UNLOCK=0 during normal operation.

LPBE, low power bias mode enable. This bit enables the low power bias operation mode. The selection of the operation mode shall only be changed while the PSQ is in OFF state (changes during other states of the PSQ causes corrupt measurement results and irregular triggers of sub modules ba ASQ)

bitenum.description: For manual bias mode and regular ASQ bias mode. In this configuration the user controls by the ASQBSW has full control over the TxBias and RxBias switches.

Low power bias mode. In this mode the ASQ uses the CHxEBSW and PGABSW as auxiliary values to achieve faster channel setting on reactive input loads. The ASQ has full controls over the bias switch multiplexer.

bitfield.description: Reserved for future use
This bit enables the charge pump of the input multiplexer.

bitenum.description: Charge pump is turned on by SDHS and ASQ related requests only.
Charge pump is turned on regardless of SDHS and ASQ related charge pump requests.

bitfield.description: Reserved for future use
These bits define the impedance of the buffers for RxBias and TxBias. While for resistive loads the lowest impedance shows the fastest settling; is this not the case for reactive loads.

bitenum.description: 200 Ohms buffer impedance for RxBias and TxBias
600 Ohms buffer impedance for RxBias and TxBias
1200 Ohms buffer impedance for RxBias and TxBias (default)
2800 Ohms buffer impedance for RxBias and TxBias

bitfield.description: When UNLOCK = 1, the trim registers are allowed to be updated (CH0PUT, CH0PDT, CH0TT, CH1PUT, CH1PDT, and CH1TT).
Input Multiplexer Channel Select

bitenum.description: Channel 0 is selected for input
Channel 1 is selected for input
reserved for future channels
reserved for future channels
reserved for future channels
reserved for future channels
reserved for future channels
reserved for future channels
no channel is selected
no channel is selected
no channel is selected
no channel is selected
no channel is selected
no channel is selected
no channel is selected
no channel is selected

bitfield.description: PGA dummy load enable on the deselected multiplexer inputs.

bitenum.description: PGA dummy input load is Hi-Z.
PGA dummy input load matches the PGA input impedance.

bitfield.description: Input Multiplexer Control source

bitenum.description: The input multiplexer is controlled by ICTL0.MUXSEL (register mode)
The input multiplexer is controlled by ASQ (auto mode)

bitfield.description: External PGA Bias Switch 0 control

bitenum.description: External bias switch is open (no bias driven)
External bias switch is closed (bias is driven)

bitfield.description: External PGA Bias Switch 1 control

bitenum.description: External bias switch is open (no bias driven)
External bias switch is closed (bias is driven)

bitfield.description: XPB0 Pin Function Enable

bitenum.description: XPB0 pin function disabled
XPB0 pin function enabled

bitfield.description: XPB1 Pin Function Enable

bitenum.description: XPB1 pin function disabled
XPB1 pin function enabled

bitfield.description: Tx bias and Rx bias switches control source select

bitenum.description: Bias switches are controlled by BCTL.CH0EBSW, BCTL.CH1EBSW, BCTL.PGABSW bits (register mode).
Bias switches are controlled by ASQ (auto mode)

bitfield.description: Rx bias (PGA bias) switch control. Note that the channel to apply the Rx bias is determined by ICTL0.MUXSEL.

bitenum.description: Rx bias switch is open.
Rx bias switch is closed (enabled).

bitfield.description: Excitation bias (Rx bias) Voltage Select

bitenum.description: 0.2V nominal
0.3V nominal
0.4V nominal
0.6V nominal

bitfield.description: PGA bias (Rx bias) Voltage Select

bitenum.description: 0.75V nominal
0.8V nominal
0.9V nominal
0.95V nominal

bitfield.description: Channel 0 Tx bias Switch Control. Note that the Tx bias voltage is determined by BCTL.EXCBIAS.

bitenum.description: Tx bias switch to CH0 is open.
Tx bias switch to CH0 is closed (enabled).

bitfield.description: Channel 1 Tx bias Switch Control. Note that the Tx bias voltage is determined by BCTL.EXCBIAS.

bitenum.description: Tx bias switch to CH1 is open.
Tx bias switch to CH1 is closed (enabled).

bitfield.description: Enable the power supply (Charge Pump) for the the input multiplexer during data acquisition.

bitenum.description: Turn off the charge pump during data acquisition.
Keep turning on the charge pump during data acquisition.

bitfield.description: Line input leakage compensation (LILC) enable.

bitenum.description: LICL is disabled.
LICL is enabled.

bitfield.description: Excitation Pulse Count. This bit field defines the number of excitation pulses. Minimum value is zero.
Stop Pulse Count; This bit field defines the number of stop pulses. Minimum value is zero. Stop pulses have the inverted polarity of excitation pulses.
Pulse Polarity. This bit defines the polarity of the first excitation pulse.

bitenum.description: The excitation begins with logical high phase. The stop begines with logical low phase.
The excitation begins with logical low phase. The stop begines with logical high phase.

bitfield.description: PPG ouptut level during inactive. This bit affects the status of PPG output before and after excitations. Note that this bit is only valid when PGC.PHIZ =0.

bitenum.description: PPG output is low during inactive
PPG output is high during inactive

bitfield.description: Hi-Z enable to PPG output during inactive.

bitenum.description: PPG output during inactive is determined by PGC.PLEV bit.
PPG output is in Hi-Z during inactive regardless of PGC.PLEV bit.

bitfield.description: Low phase period of PPG excitation pulses. This value defines the length of the low phase of the pulses. The minimum count is two regardless of the value set in this register.
High phase period of PPG excitation pulses. This value defines the length of the high phase of the pulses. The minimum count is two regardless of the value set in this register.
PPG output channel select source.

bitenum.description: PPG output channel is selected by PGCTL.PPGCHSEL bit (register mode).
PPG output channel is selected by ASQ (auto mode).

bitfield.description: PPG output channel select when PGCTL.PGSEL = 0.

bitenum.description: CH0 is selected
CH1 is selected

bitfield.description: PPG Trigger source select.

bitenum.description: Writing 1 to PPGTRIG.PPGTRIG to trigger the PPG (start pulse generation).
PPG trigger is controlled by the ASQ.
Ext. Signal (See device specific datasheet)
Ext. Signal (See device specific datasheet)

bitfield.description: PPGEN PPG trigger enable. This bit can be used to indicates that the configuration of the pulse generator is complete. The PPG can only be started when this bit is set to 1 regardless of its trigger source. It is recommended to keep this bit zero while updating PPG registers.

bitenum.description: PPG trigger is disabled.
PPG trigger is enabled.

bitfield.description: Tone generation enable. The frequency of the test tone is determined by LPER and HPER. The test tone persists while PGCTL.TONE = 1 & PGCTL.STOP=0. Either writing 0 to PGCTL.TONE or writing 1 to PGCTL.STOP stops tone generation.

bitenum.description: Test tone generation is disabled. Note: This bit is automatically cleared when writing '1' to PGCTL.STOP, and it stops test tone generation immediately.
Test tone generation is enabled.

bitfield.description: Writing one to this bit stopps the PPG to generate pulses. This bit is cleared automatically.
PPG pre scaler enable.

bitenum.description: Prescaler is disabled. PPG clock = PLL output clock.
Prescaler by four is enabled. PPG clock = 1/4 of the PLL output clock.

bitfield.description: Writing '1' to this bit triggers the PPG to generate pulses when PGCTL.TRSEL =0. Note: This bit is write only. Reading always returns with zero.

XPULS Extra Pulse Count; This bit field defines the count of extra excitation pulses excited. If set to zero no extra excitation pulses are generated. Directly after the start the regular excitation phase is entered. Any other number will generate up the number of excitation pulses set by this field .
Phase Status of PPG

bitenum.description: PPG in Pause Phase
PPG in Stop Phase
PPG in Regular Excitation phase
PPG in Extra Excitation Phase

bitfield.description: Extended Mode Select

bitenum.description: Single tone generation (Pause-E-S-Pause)
Dual Tone Generation (Pause-X-E-S-Pause)
Dual Tone Loop (X-E-X-E triggers events)

bitfield.description: Event type. Selects the type of the event generated in XMOD=3

bitenum.description: Timer count event
DMA trigger event

bitfield.description: XLPER low phase period of the extra pulses. This value defines the length of the low phase of the extra pulses in units of high speed clocks. The minimum count is two regardless of the value set in this register.

XHPER high phase period of the extra pulses. This value defines the length of the high phase of the pulses in units of high speed clocks. The minimum count is two regardless of the value set in this register.

The total number of measurements to be performed. 0 = 1 measurement will be performed (Min) 1 = 2 measurements will be performed 2 = 3 measurements will be performed 3 = 4 measurements will be performed (Max) Note: This bit field is static, does not reflect the currently reamining measurement numbers.
This bit selects the channel to start with when ASQ contols the measuremnet sequences.

bitenum.description: CH0 is selected to start with. If ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3 and ASCTL1.CHTOG =1, then the channel selection would be CH0 - CH1 - CH0 - CH1. If ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3 and ASCTL1.CHTOG =0, then the channel selection would be CH0 - CH0 - CH0 - CH0.

CH1 is selected to start with. If ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3 and ASCTL1.CHTOG =0, then the channel selection would be CH1 - CH1 - CH1 - CH1. If ASCTL0.PNGCNT = 3 and ASCTL1.CHTOG =1, then the channel selection would be CH1 - CH0 - CH1 - CH0.

bitfield.description: Stop the ASQ. Writing '1' to this bit stops the measurement sequence controlled by the ASQ. This bit is self cleared.

ASQ Trigger Enable. This bit can be used to indicate that the configuration of the ASQ is complete. The ASQ can only be triggered when this bit is set to '1' regardless of its trigger source. It is recommended to keep this bit zero while updating ASQ registerds.

bitenum.description: ASQ trigger is disabled.
ASQ trigger is enabled.

bitfield.description: ASQ trigger select.

bitenum.description: Writing '1' to ASQTRIG.ASQTRIG
The PSQ is selected to start the ASQ.
Ext. Signal (See device specific datasheet)
Ext. Signal (See device specific datasheet)

bitfield.description: Stop ASQ when the DATAERR interrupt occurrs when the mesurements controlled by ASQ (auto mode). Note that it is not possible to resume the measurement from where it was stopped. When ASQ is triggered again, the measurement seqeunce starts from the beginning.

bitenum.description: Continue the measurements until completion regardless of the DATAERR interrupt.
Stop the ASQ upon the DATAERR interrupt.

bitfield.description: Channel toggle enable at each PNGDN interrupt.

bitenum.description: Channel toggle is disabled.
Channel toggle is enabled at each PNGDN interrupt.

bitfield.description: Read Only bit. This bit indicates the currently selected Tx channel.
Early Receive Bias Control. The Rx bias is applied at the TIMEMARK C, but when this bit is set to '1', the Rx bias is applied at the TIMEMARK A.

bitenum.description: Rx bias is applied to the Rx channel by the TIMEMARK C
Rx bias is applied to the Rx channel by the TIMEMARK A

bitfield.description: Enable the OFF request when ASQ completes all of the measurement sequences.

bitenum.description: OFF request is disabled. The ASQ does not send a request about USS power mode to the PSQ.
OFF request is generated after sequence

bitfield.description: ASQ can send a request sigal to the PSQ (Power Sequencer) of the USS module when the OFF request is received (See ASCTL1.ESOFF and the UUPS module).

bitenum.description: The ASQ sends a power down request to the PSQ (Power Sequencer) when the OFF request is received.
The ASQ sends a standby request to the PSQ (Power Sequencer) when the OFF request is received.

bitfield.description: In general, if CH0 is selected for Tx, CH1 is selected for Rx. However, when this bit is set to '1', the Tx channel and Rx channel are identical. This bit can be used for debugging purpose.

bitenum.description: Tx channel and Rx channel are not the same (This is the typical configuration).
Tx channel and Rx channel are identical.

bitfield.description: Writing '1' to this bit trigger the ASQ when ASCTL0.TRIGSEL = 0. Note: This bit is write only. Reading always returns with zero.

Bit 0 defines the PPG pulse polarity for the first measurement. Bit 1 defines the PPG pulse polarity for the second measurement. Bit 2 defines the PPG pulse polarity for the third measurement. Bit 3 defines the PPG pulse polarity for the fourth measurement. 0 = PPG output pulses starts with logical high polarity. 1 = PPG output pulses starts with logical low polarity.

Bit 0 defines the PPG output level at pause for the first measurement when PCPHIZ bit 0 = 0. Bit 1 defines the PPG output level at pause for the second measurement when PCPHIZ bit 1 = 0. Bit 2 defines the PPG output level at pause for the third measurement when PCPHIZ bit 2 = 0. Bit 3 defines the PPG output level at pause for the fourth measurement when PCPHIZ bit 3 = 0. 0 = Logical Low. 1 = Logical High.

Bit 0 defines the PPG output status at pause for the first measurement. Bit 1 defines the PPG output status at pause for the second measurement. Bit 2 defines the PPG output status at pause for the third measurement. Bit 3 defines the PPG output status at pause for the fourth measurement. 0 = PPG ouput level is determined by APLEV.PCPLEV bits 1 = Hi-z. regardless of APLEV.PCPLEV bits

register.description: Count for the TIMEMARK C Event

bitfield.description: The ASQ time counter clear. Writing '1' to this bit clears the the counter value. The counter must be stopped prior to be cleared. This bit is self cleared. TSTOP, TSTART, and TCLR bits are offerred for only debugging purpose. It is not recommend to use this bit while ASQ is active. Note: This bit is write only. Reading always returns with zero.

The ASQ time counter start. Writing '1' to this bit starts the counter. This bit is self cleared. TSTOP, TSTART, and TCLR bits are offerred for only debugging purpose. It is not recommend to use this bit while ASQ is active. Note: This bit is write only. Reading always returns with zero.

The ASQ time counter stop. Writing '1' to this bit stops the counter. This bit is self cleared. TSTOP, TSTART, and TCLR bits are offerred for only debugging purpose. It is not recommend to use this bit while ASQ is active. Note: This bit is write only. Reading always returns with zero.

ASQ pre-scaler shift. The value written to the PSSV bits shifts the start point of the ASQ's pre-scaler. Note that the value only affects the first cycle of the pre-scaler. 0 = No shift 1 = The pre-scaler starts 1 clock later 2 = The pre-scaler starts 2 clocks later ... 15 = The pre-scaler starts 15 clocks later
ASQ Timer Counter high part. The reading this register returns the counter value [19:16].
